transformation.text: The wound is the place where the Light enters you.
transformation.author: Rumi

transformation.text: What the caterpillar calls the end of the world, the master calls a butterfly.
transformation.author: Richard Bach

transformation.text: We must be willing to let go of the life we planned so as to have the life that is waiting for us.
transformation.author: Joseph Campbell

transformation.text: Yesterday I was clever, so I wanted to change the world. Today I am wise, so I am changing myself.
transformation.author: Rumi

courage.text: Do not be satisfied with the stories that come before you. Unfold your own myth.
courage.author: Rumi

courage.text: I am not afraid of storms, for I am learning how to sail my ship.
courage.author: Louisa May Alcott

courage.text: Courage is resistance to fear, mastery of fear—not absence of fear.
courage.author: Mark Twain

love.text: Love is the voice under all silences, the hope which has no opposite in fear.
love.author: E.E. Cummings

love.text: The minute I heard my first love story, I started looking for you, not knowing how blind that was. Lovers don't finally meet somewhere. They're in each other all along.
love.author: Rumi

love.text: We are shaped and fashioned by what we love.
love.author: Goethe

love.text: Keep love in your heart. A life without it is like a sunless garden when the flowers are dead.
love.author: Oscar Wilde

uncertainty.text: Be patient towards all that is unsolved in your heart and try to love the questions themselves.
uncertainty.author: Rainer Maria Rilke

uncertainty.text: Not all those who wander are lost.
uncertainty.author: J.R.R. Tolkien

uncertainty.text: The only way to make sense out of change is to plunge into it, move with it, and join the dance.
uncertainty.author: Alan Watts

uncertainty.text: Uncertainty is the refuge of hope.
uncertainty.author: Henri Frederic Amiel

time.text: Nature does not hurry, yet everything is accomplished.
time.author: Lao Tzu

time.text: How did it get so late so soon?
time.author: Dr. Seuss

time.text: Time is a created thing. To say 'I don't have time' is to say 'I don't want to.'
time.author: Lao Tzu

time.text: The future is something which everyone reaches at the rate of sixty minutes an hour, whatever he does, whoever he is.
time.author: C.S. Lewis

self.text: To be yourself in a world that is constantly trying to make you something else is the greatest accomplishment.
self.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

self.text: I am not what happened to me, I am what I choose to become.
self.author: Carl Jung

self.text: Knowing yourself is the beginning of all wisdom.
self.author: Aristotle

self.text: The privilege of a lifetime is to become who you truly are.
self.author: Carl Jung

loss.text: The reality is that you will grieve forever. You will not 'get over' the loss of a loved one; you will learn to live with it.
loss.author: Elisabeth Kübler-Ross

loss.text: What we have once enjoyed we can never lose. All that we love deeply becomes a part of us.
loss.author: Helen Keller

loss.text: Grief is the price we pay for love.
loss.author: Queen Elizabeth II

loss.text: Unable are the loved to die, for love is immortality.
loss.author: Emily Dickinson

joy.text: Let yourself be silently drawn by the strange pull of what you really love. It will not lead you astray.
joy.author: Rumi

joy.text: Find ecstasy in life; the mere sense of living is joy enough.
joy.author: Emily Dickinson

joy.text: The soul should always stand ajar, ready to welcome the ecstatic experience.
joy.author: Emily Dickinson

joy.text: I have spread my dreams under your feet. Tread softly because you tread on my dreams.
joy.author: W.B. Yeats

beginnings.text: Every new beginning comes from some other beginning's end.
beginnings.author: Seneca

beginnings.text: What we call the beginning is often the end. And to make an end is to make a beginning.
beginnings.author: T.S. Eliot

beginnings.text: There will come a time when you believe everything is finished. That will be the beginning.
beginnings.author: Louis L'Amour

beginnings.text: The secret of getting ahead is getting started.
beginnings.author: Mark Twain

endings.text: Nothing is lost. Everything is transformed.
endings.author: Michael Ende

endings.text: Every exit is an entry somewhere else.
endings.author: Tom Stoppard

endings.text: Goodbyes are only for those who love with their eyes. Because for those who love with heart and soul there is no such thing as separation.
endings.author: Rumi

endings.text: The end is where we start from.
endings.author: T.S. Eliot
